actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 98-653.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported with amendments favorably.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Andrews with amendments. With written report No. 98-440.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 864.
Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

official_title: A bill to provide for the statutory designation of the position of Assistant Secretary of the Interior for Indian Affairs, eliminate the position of Commissioner of Indian Affairs, make conforming amendments, repeal unnecessary provisions of law referring to the Commissioner of Indian Affairs, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) Eliminates the statutory position of Commissioner of Indian Affairs in the Department of the Interior. Replaces it with the statutory position of Assistant Secretary of the Interior for Indian Affairs. Provides that such replacement does not preclude the Board of Indian Appeals from exercising administrative review over decisions rendered by the Bureau of Indian Affairs. Makes technical and conforming amendments. Considers any presidential appointment of any person as Assistant Secretary for the Department of the Interior responsible for Indian affairs and serving as such on the date of enactment of this Act to be an appointment as Assistant Secretary for Indian Affairs.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the statutory designation of the position of Assistant Secretary of the Interior for Indian Affairs, eliminate the position of Commissioner of Indian Affairs, make conforming amendments, repeal unnecessary provisions of law referring to the Commissioner of Indian Affairs, and for other purposes.
